member.name: F:System.Xml.ValidationType.Schema
member.summary: Validate according to XML Schema definition language (XSD) schemas, including inline XML Schemas. XML Schemas are associated with namespace URIs either by using the schemaLocation attribute or the provided Schemas property.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.CloneNode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of this node.
member.returns: The cloned node.
member.param: true to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself. Because XmlDeclaration nodes do not have children, the cloned node always includes the data value, regardless of the parameter setting.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding level of the XML document.
member.returns: The valid character encoding name. The most commonly supported character encoding names for XML are the following: Category Encoding Names Unicode UTF-8, UTF-16 ISO 10646 ISO-10646-UCS-2, ISO-10646-UCS-4 ISO 8859 ISO-8859-n (where "n" is a digit from 1 to 9) JIS X-0208-1997 ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, EUC-JP This value is optional. If a value is not set, this property returns String.Empty.If an encoding attribute is not included, UTF-8 encoding is assumed when the document is written or saved out.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.InnerText
member.summary: Gets or sets the concatenated values of the XmlDeclaration.
member.returns: The concatenated values of the XmlDeclaration (that is, everything between <?xml and ?>).

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.LocalName
member.summary: Gets the local name of the node.
member.returns: For XmlDeclaration nodes, the local name is xml.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.Name
member.summary: Gets the qualified name of the node.
member.returns: For XmlDeclaration nodes, the name is xml.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.NodeType
member.summary: Gets the type of the current node.
member.returns: For XmlDeclaration nodes, this value is XmlNodeType.XmlDeclaration.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.Standalone
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the standalone attribute.
member.returns: Valid values are yes if all entity declarations required by the XML document are contained within the document or no if an external document type definition (DTD) is required. If a standalone attribute is not present in the XML declaration, this property returns String.Empty.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the XmlDeclaration.
member.returns: The contents of the XmlDeclaration (that is, everything between <?xml and ?>).

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlDeclaration.Version
member.summary: Gets the XML version of the document.
member.returns: The value is always 1.0.

The value of the encoding attribute. This is the encoding that is used when you save the to a file or a stream; therefore, it must be set to a string supported by the class, otherwise fails. If this is null or String.Empty, the Save method does not write an encoding attribute on the XML declaration and therefore the default encoding, UTF-8, is used.Note: If the XmlDocument is saved to either a or an , this encoding value is discarded. Instead, the encoding of the TextWriter or the XmlTextWriter is used. This ensures that the XML written out can be read back using the correct encoding.
The value must be either "yes" or "no". If this is null or String.Empty, the Save method does not write a standalone attribute on the XML declaration.
member.exception: The values of or are something other than the ones specified above.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlNode.Normalize
member.summary: Puts all XmlText nodes in the full depth of the sub-tree underneath this XmlNode into a "normal" form where only markup (that is, tags, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, and entity references) separates XmlText nodes, that is, there are no adjacent XmlText nodes.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlNode.OwnerDocument

member.returns: The to which this node belongs.If the node is an (NodeType equals XmlNodeType.Document), this property returns null.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlNode.ParentNode
member.summary: Gets the parent of this node (for nodes that can have parents).
member.returns: The XmlNode that is the parent of the current node. If a node has just been created and not yet added to the tree, or if it has been removed from the tree, the parent is null. For all other nodes, the value returned depends on the of the node. The following table describes the possible return values for the ParentNode property.NodeType Return Value of ParentNode Attribute, Document, DocumentFragment, Entity, Notation Returns null; these nodes do not have parents. CDATA Returns the element or entity reference containing the CDATA section. Comment Returns the element, entity reference, document type, or document containing the comment. DocumentType Returns the document node. Element Returns the parent node of the element. If the element is the root node in the tree, the parent is the document node. EntityReference Returns the element, attribute, or entity reference containing the entity reference. ProcessingInstruction Returns the document, element, document type, or entity reference containing the processing instruction. Text Returns the parent element, attribute, or entity reference containing the text node.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlNode.Prefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the namespace prefix of this node.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent
member.summary: Checks whether the current node is a content (non-white space text, CDATA, Element, EndElement, EntityReference, or EndEntity) node. If the node is not a content node, the reader skips ahead to the next content node or end of file. It skips over nodes of the following type: ProcessingInstruction, DocumentType, Comment, Whitespace, or SignificantWhitespace.
member.returns: The of the current node found by the method or XmlNodeType.None if the reader has reached the end of the input stream.
member.exception: Incorrect XML encountered in the input stream.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToElement
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves to the element that contains the current attribute node.
member.returns: true if the reader is positioned on an attribute (the reader moves to the element that owns the attribute); false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute (the position of the reader does not change).

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToFirstAttribute
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves to the first attribute.
member.returns: true if an attribute exists (the reader moves to the first attribute); otherwise, false (the position of the reader does not change).

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves to the next attribute.
member.returns: true if there is a next attribute; false if there are no more attributes.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlReader.Name
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the qualified name of the current node.
member.returns: The qualified name of the current node. For example, Name is bk:book for the element <bk:book>.The name returned is dependent on the of the node. The following node types return the listed values. All other node types return an empty string.Node type Name AttributeThe name of the attribute. DocumentTypeThe document type name. ElementThe tag name. EntityReferenceThe name of the entity referenced. ProcessingInstructionThe target of the processing instruction. XmlDeclarationThe literal string xml.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlReader.NamespaceURI
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the namespace URI (as defined in the W3C Namespace specification) of the node on which the reader is positioned.
member.returns: The namespace URI of the current node; otherwise an empty string.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlReader.NameTable
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the associated with this implementation.
member.returns: The XmlNameTable enabling you to get the atomized version of a string within the node.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlReader.NodeType
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the type of the current node.
member.returns: One of the values representing the type of the current node.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlReader.Prefix
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the namespace prefix associated with the current node.
member.returns: The namespace prefix associated with the current node.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlReader.QuoteChar
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the quotation mark character used to enclose the value of an attribute node.
member.returns: The quotation mark character (" or ') used to enclose the value of an attribute node.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads the next node from the stream.
member.returns: true if the next node was read successfully; false if there are no more nodes to read.
member.exception: An error occurred while parsing the XML.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.ReadAttributeValue
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, parses the attribute value into one or more Text, EntityReference, or EndEntity nodes.
member.returns: true if there are nodes to return.false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute node when the initial call is made or if all the attribute values have been read.An empty attribute, such as, misc="", returns true with a single node with a value of String.Empty.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.ResolveEntity
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, resolves the entity reference for EntityReference nodes.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlReader.SchemaInfo
member.summary: Gets the schema information that has been assigned to the current node as a result of schema validation.
member.returns: An object containing the schema information for the current node. Schema information can be set on elements, attributes, or on text nodes with a non-null (typed values). If the current node is not one of the above node types, or if the XmlReader instance does not report schema information, this property returns null.If this property is called from an or an object, this property always returns null. These XmlReader implementations do not expose schema information through the SchemaInfo property.NoteIf you have to get the post-schema-validation information set (PSVI) for an element, position the reader on the end tag of the element, rather than on the start tag. You get the PSVI through the SchemaInfo property of a reader. The validating reader that is created through with the property set to has complete PSVI for an element only when the reader is positioned on the end tag of an element.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlReader.Value
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the text value of the current node.

All other node types return String.Empty.Node type Value AttributeThe value of the attribute. CDATAThe content of the CDATA section. CommentThe content of the comment. DocumentTypeThe internal subset. ProcessingInstructionThe entire content, excluding the target. SignificantWhitespaceThe white space between markup in a mixed content model. TextThe content of the text node. WhitespaceThe white space between markup. XmlDeclarationThe content of the declaration.

member.summary: Represents the severity of the validation event.

member.name: F:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSeverityType.Error
member.summary: Indicates a validation error occurred when validating the instance document. This applies to document type definitions (DTDs) and XML Schema definition language (XSD) schemas. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) validity constraints are considered errors. If no validation event handler has been created, errors throw an exception.

member.name: F:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSeverityType.Warning
member.summary: Indicates that a validation event occurred that is not an error. A warning is typically issued when there is no DTD, or XML Schema to validate a particular element or attribute against. Unlike errors, warnings do not throw an exception if there is no validation event handler.

member.summary: Prevents a specified name from being used within the instance's scope.

member.summary: Removes all code entities or type mappings, including their names, from the instance's scope.

member.summary: Determines whether a specified name is already being used within the instance's scope.
member.returns: true if the name is already in use; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Ensures that the input is of the correct case by modifying the name according to the value of the property.
member.returns: A string that is the same as the input identifier or has the first letter's case modified.
member.param: The name to possibly modify.

member.name: M:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.MakeUnique(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the input name conflicts with another name within the instance's scope and, if it does, generates a modified string.
member.returns: The identifier parameter value or a modified string if there is a name collision.
member.param: The name to modify if it is not already unique.

member.summary: Removes the input name from the instance's reserved names.
member.param: A name that will be made available within the instance's scope.

member.summary: Returns an array of the code entities or type mappings within the instance's scope.

member.param: The type of all the code entities or type mappings for the instance.

member.name: M:System.Xml.Xsl.XslTransform.Load(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.Xml.XmlResolver,System.Security.Policy.Evidence)

member.param: An object containing the style sheet to load.
The used to load any style sheets referenced in xsl:import and xsl:include elements. If this is null, external resources are not resolved.The is not cached after the method completes.

The set on the assembly generated for the script block in the XSLT style sheet.If this is null, script blocks are not processed, the XSLT document() function is not supported, and privileged extension objects are disallowed.The caller must have ControlEvidence permission in order to supply evidence for the script assembly. Semi-trusted callers can set this parameter to null.
member.exception: The current node does not conform to a valid style sheet.
The referenced style sheet requires functionality that is not allowed by the evidence provided.The caller tries to supply evidence and does not have ControlEvidence permission.

member.summary: Loads the XSLT style sheet contained in the .

The used to load any style sheets referenced in xsl:import and xsl:include elements. If this is null, external resources are not resolved.The is not cached after the method completes.
member.exception: The current node does not conform to a valid style sheet.

member.name: M:System.Xml.Xsl.XslTransform.Load(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Xml.XmlResolver,System.Security.Policy.Evidence)
member.summary: Loads the XSLT style sheet contained in the . This method allows you to limit the permissions of the style sheet by specifying evidence.
member.param: An object containing the style sheet to load.
The used to load any style sheets referenced in xsl:import and xsl:include elements. If this is null, external resources are not resolved.The is not cached after the method completes.

The set on the assembly generated for the script block in the XSLT style sheet.If this is null, script blocks are not processed, the XSLT document() function is not supported, and privileged extension objects are disallowed.The caller must have ControlEvidence permission in order to supply evidence for the script assembly. Semi-trusted callers can set this parameter to null.
member.exception: The current node does not conform to a valid style sheet.
The referenced style sheet requires functionality that is not allowed by the evidence provided.The caller tries to supply evidence and does not have ControlEvidence permission.

member.name: T:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltSettings
member.summary: Specifies the XSLT features to support during execution of the XSLT style sheet.

member.name: M:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

member.name: M:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltSettings.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified settings.
member.param: true to enable support for the XSLT document() function; otherwise, false.
true to enable support for embedded scripts blocks; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltSettings.Default
member.summary: Gets an object with default settings. Support for the XSLT document() function and embedded script blocks is disabled.
member.returns: An object with the and properties set to false.

member.name: P:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltSettings.EnableDocumentFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable support for the XSLT document() function.
member.returns: true to support the XSLT document() function; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltSettings.EnableScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable support for embedded script blocks.
member.returns: true to support script blocks in XSLT style sheets; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltSettings.TrustedXslt
member.summary: Gets an object that enables support for the XSLT document() function and embedded script blocks.
member.returns: An object with the and properties set to true.
